page.title: The History of Kava
page.subtitle: A journey through 5,000 years of Kava history ‚Äì from domestication in Melanesia to global spread in the modern world.

prehistory.name: Prehistory & Domestication
prehistory.description: The beginnings of Kava culture in Melanesia

domestication.title: Domestication of Kava
domestication.description: In the rainforests of Papua New Guinea and Vanuatu, the domestication of Piper wichmannii into the cultivated Kava plant (Piper methysticum) begins.
domestication.details: Through selective breeding and vegetative propagation, the first Noble Kava varieties emerge with higher kavalactone content and lower toxicity than the wild ancestor.

vanuatu-culture.title: First Kava Ceremonies in Vanuatu
vanuatu-culture.description: On the islands of Vanuatu, the first ritual Kava ceremonies develop. The Nakamal becomes the central gathering place.
vanuatu-culture.details: Preparation through chewing the root by young men establishes itself as tradition. Kava becomes the medium of communication with ancestors and spirits.

lapita-expansion.title: Lapita Expansion
lapita-expansion.description: The Lapita culture spreads Kava through their maritime expansion from Melanesia to Western Polynesia.
lapita-expansion.details: Archaeological finds of Lapita pottery show the expansion routes. Kava plants are transported as cuttings on outrigger canoes.

fiji-arrival.title: Kava Reaches Fiji
fiji-arrival.description: Kava is introduced to Fiji and becomes known as 'Yaqona'. Unique ceremonies develop around the Tanoa (Kava bowl).
fiji-arrival.details: Originally, Kava in Fiji was prepared by grinding, not chewing. The connection to ancestor worship in the B≈´rau (men's houses) is established.

tonga-samoa.title: Kava in Tonga and Samoa
tonga-samoa.description: The 'Ava ceremony develops in Tonga and Samoa into a highly formalized tradition with strict hierarchy.
tonga-samoa.details: The Tou'a (Kava mixer) and the MatƒÅpule (ceremony master) become important ritual roles. The drinking order reflects the social order.

hawaii-arrival.title: Kava Reaches Hawaii
hawaii-arrival.description: Polynesian seafarers bring Kava to Hawaii, where it becomes known as 'Awa and is connected to the goddess Hina.
hawaii-arrival.details: In Hawaii, a unique Kava culture develops with connections to healing rituals of the Kahuna (priests). The variety 'Awa Hiwa is reserved for ceremonial purposes.

pohnpei-sakau.title: Sakau Culture in Pohnpei
pohnpei-sakau.description: On Pohnpei in Micronesia, the Sakau ceremony develops as an independent tradition.
pohnpei-sakau.details: Preparation on a flat stone and pressing through hibiscus fibers become characteristic of Micronesian Kava culture.

fiji-tongan-influence.title: Tongan Influence on Fiji
fiji-tongan-influence.description: Fiji adopts Tongan Kava ceremonies: mastication, Tanoa bowls and Bilo cups become standard.
fiji-tongan-influence.details: The Sevusevu ceremony as formal greeting establishes itself. Christian missionaries favor the 'more civilized' Polynesian ceremonies.

european-contact.title: First European Contact
european-contact.description: Dutch seafarers under Jacob Le Maire and Willem Schouten reach the Pacific islands and document Kava for the first time.
european-contact.details: Europeans describe the 'strange drink' of the natives but do not understand its cultural significance.

cook-documentation.title: Captain Cook's Documentation
cook-documentation.description: James Cook extensively documents Kava ceremonies during his Pacific voyages and brings samples to Europe.
cook-documentation.details: Cook's reports on the 'Ava ceremony in Tonga and Hawaii spark scientific interest in Europe. Botanist Johann Georg Forster describes the plant scientifically for the first time.

forster-classification.title: Scientific Classification
forster-classification.description: Johann Georg Forster classifies Kava as Piper methysticum ('intoxicating pepper plant').
forster-classification.details: The name derives from the Greek 'methystikos' (intoxicating). Forster describes the plant in his work 'De Plantis Esculentis Insularum Oceani Australis'.

missionary-opposition.title: Missionary Opposition
missionary-opposition.description: Christian missionaries fight Kava as a 'pagan' drink. In some regions, ceremonies are banned.
missionary-opposition.details: Missionaries criticize chewing as unhygienic and ceremonies as 'lazy, corrupting, even demonic'. On East Futuna, mastication is discontinued in 1930 following missionary mandate.

kavalactone-discovery.title: Discovery of Kavalactones
kavalactone-discovery.description: German chemists isolate the active compounds from Kava for the first time and name them 'Kavain'.
kavalactone-discovery.details: The discovery lays the foundation for scientific research on Kava's effects and later pharmaceutical applications.

german-colony.title: German Colonial Rule
german-colony.description: Germany controls parts of the Pacific (German New Guinea, Samoa). Kava is scientifically researched.
german-colony.details: German scientists document Kava varieties and preparation methods. The colonial administration largely tolerates Kava consumption.

lewin-research.title: Louis Lewin's Research
lewin-research.description: German toxicologist Louis Lewin publishes comprehensive studies on Kava and classifies it as 'Euphorica'.
lewin-research.details: Lewin's work 'Phantastica' becomes the standard work of psychopharmacology. He describes Kava as one of the most important stimulants of humanity.

independence-movements.title: Independence & Cultural Renaissance
independence-movements.description: Pacific states gain independence. Kava returns to public space as a symbol of cultural identity.
independence-movements.details: Samoa (1962), Fiji (1970), Tonga (1970), Vanuatu (1980) become independent. Kava ceremonies are celebrated at state foundations and official occasions.

vanuatu-independence.title: Vanuatu Becomes Independent
vanuatu-independence.description: Vanuatu gains independence from French-British colonial rule. Kava becomes a national symbol.
vanuatu-independence.details: The new nation makes Kava part of its identity. Nakamals become important social institutions in Port Vila and other cities.

clinical-research.title: Clinical Studies on Anxiety
clinical-research.description: First controlled clinical studies show the anxiolytic effect of Kava extracts.
clinical-research.details: Meta-analyses confirm the effectiveness of Kava for anxiety disorders. Kava preparations become popular as herbal medicines in Europe and the USA.

first-kava-bars.title: First Kava Bars in the USA
first-kava-bars.description: In Florida and California, the first Western Kava bars open as alcohol-free alternatives.
first-kava-bars.details: The Kava bar movement begins in cities with Pacific diaspora. Fort Lauderdale becomes the center of the American Kava scene.

german-ban.title: Kava Ban in Germany
german-ban.description: Germany bans Kava preparations after reports of liver damage. Other EU countries follow.
german-ban.details: The BfArM revokes the approval of all Kava-containing medicines. The decision is based on 30 suspected cases of hepatotoxicity but is later criticized as excessive.

vanuatu-noble-policy.title: Vanuatu's Noble-Only Export Policy
vanuatu-noble-policy.description: Vanuatu introduces strict export guidelines: Only Noble Kava varieties may be exported.
vanuatu-noble-policy.details: The policy aims to ensure quality and protect Kava's reputation. Tudei varieties with higher DHM/DHK content are excluded from export.

who-assessment.title: WHO Risk Assessment
who-assessment.description: The WHO publishes a comprehensive risk assessment and classifies traditionally prepared Kava as safe.
who-assessment.details: The assessment distinguishes between traditional preparation (safe) and extracts (potentially problematic). The use of non-root parts is identified as a risk factor.

german-rehabilitation.title: Rehabilitation in Germany
german-rehabilitation.description: German courts overturn the Kava ban. The original decision is classified as scientifically unfounded.
german-rehabilitation.details: The Federal Administrative Court rules that the risk assessment was flawed. Kava products can be legally sold again.

codex-standard.title: Codex Alimentarius Standard
codex-standard.description: The Codex Alimentarius adopts an international standard for Kava as a beverage.
codex-standard.details: The standard defines quality criteria, kavalactone limits and labeling requirements. A milestone for international trade.

global-expansion.title: Global Expansion of Kava Bars
global-expansion.description: Over 200 Kava bars open in the USA. The 'Sober Curious' movement drives growth.
global-expansion.details: Kava becomes popular as an alcohol-free alternative for social relaxation. Cities like Austin, Denver and New York develop vibrant Kava scenes.

climate-challenges.title: Climate Change Challenges
climate-challenges.description: Pacific Kava farmers struggle with the effects of climate change on their crops.
climate-challenges.details: Changed precipitation patterns, cyclones and rising temperatures threaten traditional growing areas. Sustainable farming methods become more important.

cultural-renaissance.title: Cultural Renaissance
cultural-renaissance.description: Young Pacific generations found 'Kava Collectives' and document traditional knowledge digitally.
cultural-renaissance.details: Podcasts, YouTube channels and Instagram accounts spread Kava culture worldwide. The connection of tradition and modernity creates new forms of cultural identity.
